title: Senior Cloud Systems Engineer
content:
At NICE, we don’t limit our challenges. We challenge our limits. Constantly. We’re relentless. We’re ambitious. And we make an impact. Our NICErs bring their A game and spend each day turning it into an A+. And if you’re like us, we can offer you the kind of challenge that will light a fire within you.NICE is looking for a Senior Cloud Systems Engineer to join our IT Infrastructure team. This role is responsible for supporting systems hosted in our Private Cloud and performing system administrative functions such as patch management, trouble-shooting hardware, application and OS issues, and deploying customer environments using Windows Server and Linux in a highly secure service provider environment.
The ideal candidate for this position will have 8+ years of relevant work experience, preferably in a fast paced, dynamic environment.  Additional requirements include:

Familiar with ITIL Framework
Ability to lead a project to completion
Stage and deploy Windows OS images on servers
Experience working in a SaaS environment
Coordinate and lead routine system patching and general administration on Windows and Linux servers
Subject Matter Expert (SME) for systems related issues


Provide Level 1 technical support for security related issues


Experience with Systems Management software especially BigFix
Maintain IT asset management system
Active Directory Subject Matter Expert
System architecture and/or design skills and experience
Soild understanding of networking concepts and fundamentals
Develop and maintain system documentation
Participate in a 24 x 7 on-call rotation schedule
Ability to work flexible schedule:

Periodic nights and/or weekends


Ability to lift 70+ pounds in the data center (Installing and maintaining equipment)

 
Required Skills / Experience
Strong Knowledge of the Following Technologies:

BS/BA in computer science or information systems
Minimum 6 years system administration experience in a Windows server environment


Proficient with Windows Power Shell or other current scripting languages


Strong working knowledge of TCP/IP network fundamentals and common protocols such as FTP, SSH, SMTP, HTTP, HTTPS
Experience with various systems management, monitoring, diagnostic, and troubleshooting tools
Excellent technical problem-solving skills combined with strong customer service attitude
Ability to work with development and operations teams to achieve desired results on common projects


Advanced understanding of computer systems characteristics, features, and integration capabilities.
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
Self-motivated individual who can work independently and as a team player, willing to share knowledge and train coworkers
Ability to balance multiple priorities and projects
Excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing, in order to discuss/document technical information
Certification in vendor or industry technologies, e.g. Microsoft, Linux, etc
Ability to handle urgent interruptions with poise and professionalism

 
Desired Skills / Experience
Strong Knowledge of the Following Technologies:

Organized and detail oriented with excellent time management skills
Highly motivated individual with a sense of urgency and ownership
Hands on experience working in a data center environment
Virtualization Experience a plus especially VMware
Experience working in a Security compliant environment (e.g. PCI/SOX/HiTrust/ISO)
About NICE 
NICE Ltd. (NASDAQ: NICE) software products are used by 25,000+ global businesses, including 85 of the Fortune 100 corporations, to deliver extraordinary customer experiences, fight financial crime and ensure public safety. Every day, NICE software manages more than 120 million customer interactions and monitors 3+ billion financial transactions. 
Known as an innovation powerhouse that excels in AI, cloud and digital, NICE is consistently recognized as the market leader in its domains, with over 8,500 employees across 30+ countries. 
NICE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, neurotype, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other category protected by law.
